Constructor Detail

PartitionSplit

public PartitionSplit(Partition partitionToSplit)
Creates a partition split. The split is defined by the messages added using addEventToSplit.

Parameters:
partitionToSplit - the partition to split

PartitionSplit

public PartitionSplit(Partition partitionToSplit,
                      Partition newPartitionArg)
Creates a partition split. The split is defined by the messages added using addEventToSplit. Will use newPartitionArg for the messages that will be split out (instead of creating a new partition) -- this is important in cases when splits need to preserve the partition set of a graph.

Parameters:
partitionToSplit - the partition to split
newPartitionArg - the partition to use for events to split out

commit

public IOperation commit(PartitionGraph g)
Description copied from interface: IOperation
Commit the changes to graphs partitionGraph and stateGraph, and return an operation that will rewind them.

Specified by:
commit in interface IOperation
Parameters:
g - the partition graph to apply to
Returns:
an operation that will undo the changes

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Check whether this partition split is valid to perform. This should be used prior to applying the operation on a graph.

Returns:
true if valid
